# Healthcare AI Vendor Intelligence - November 2025

## Market Overview
- Ambient AI scribes generating ~$600M in 2025 (2.4x YoY growth)
- Healthcare AI spending hit $1.4B in 2025 (nearly 3x increase from 2024)
- Startups capture 85% of spending vs. 15% incumbents

---

## 1. Microsoft Nuance / Dragon Copilot

**Status:** Market leader, unified platform launched March 2025

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Organizations | 400+ healthcare orgs using DAX Copilot |
| Monthly Encounters | 3M+ ambient conversations processed |
| Market Share | ~33% |

**Capabilities:**
- Ambient documentation (core)
- Referral letters, after-visit summaries
- Order suggestions with direct Epic entry
- Diagnostic evidence curation for coding
- Nursing module GA December 2025
- Wolters Kluwer UpToDate voice integration

**EHR Integration:**
- Deep Epic integration (first ambient in Epic, Feb 2024)
- Embedded in Epic Haiku (mobile) and Hyperdrive (web)
- MEDITECH Expanse announced
- 200+ EHRs via Dragon Medical One

**Pricing:** $500-700/provider/month + $700 implementation fee

**Customers:** Atrium Health, Northwestern Medicine, Stanford, UNC, Vanderbilt, Mount Sinai

**Limitations:**
- iOS only for mobile capture
- No evidence linking (audit trail gap)
- Premium pricing
- Hallucination/transcription errors reported
- Complex multi-vendor support structure

---

## 2. Abridge

**Status:** Surging - now valued at $5.3B

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Valuation | $5.3B (Series E, June 2025) |
| Total Raised | ~$800M |
| Health Systems | 150-200 deployed |
| Market Share | ~30% |

**Recent Funding:**
- Series D: $250M (Feb 2025) - $2.75B valuation
- Series E: $300M (June 2025) - $5.3B valuation

**Capabilities:**
- Ambient documentation (55+ specialties, 28+ languages)
- ED module (Jan 2025), Inpatient (June 2025)
- Contextual Reasoning Engine
- Revenue Cycle Intelligence - real-time billing validation
- Prior Authorization workflows (Highmark partnership)
- Best in KLAS 2025 for Ambient AI

**Technology:**
- Hybrid: proprietary + foundation models
- Custom medical speech recognition
- NVIDIA partnership (NIM, TensorRT-LLM)
- NOT single off-the-shelf LLM

**EHR Integration:**
- Epic "First Pal" Partner - deep integration
- athenahealth (160K+ clinicians)
- Oracle/Cerner

**Customers:** Mayo Clinic, Duke Health (5K clinicians), Johns Hopkins (6.7K clinicians), Kaiser, UPMC, Northwell (28 hospitals), Seattle Children's

**Competitive Position:**
- Maintains Epic partnership despite Epic building native AI ("Art for Clinicians")
- Differentiates on speed (fully automated vs. Nuance historical human-in-loop)
- 60-70% burnout reduction, 90%+ retention

---

## 3. Nabla

**Status:** Strong growth, European expansion

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Funding | $70M Series C (June 2025), $120M total |
| Clinicians | 85,000-100,000 |
| Organizations | 130-150 |
| Annual Encounters | 20M+ |

**Capabilities:**
- Ambient documentation
- Dictation (Feb 2025) - 55+ specialties
- Real-time coding suggestions
- Agentic AI platform
- 35+ languages
- 95% accuracy, notes in <15 seconds

**Technology:**
- Proprietary LLMs (ex-Meta AI team, 3 years, $5M+)
- 7,000 hours manually annotated medical audio
- Fine-tuned Whisper for speech-to-text
- Does NOT store audio, does NOT train on customer data

**EHR Integration:**
- Multi-EHR: Epic, Cerner, athena, NextGen, Greenway, Opus
- **Nabla Connect (Oct 2025)**: Plug-and-play module for any EHR
- Integration in days, not months

**Geographic Focus:**
- HQ: Paris, France
- NYC office for US operations
- 20K+ US clinicians
- Accelerating European expansion with Series C

**Customers:** CVS Health, Children's Hospital LA, Carle Health, Denver Health, University of Iowa

**Outcomes:** 26% burnout reduction, 15-point patient satisfaction increase, documentation time cut 50%+

---

## 4. Suki AI

**Status:** Infrastructure play, MEDITECH leader

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Funding | $70M Series D (Oct 2024) |
| Encounters | 60,000+ via athenahealth |
| ROI | 9X in year 1 (claimed) |

**Capabilities:**
- Ambient documentation (72% faster than manual)
- Coding assistance
- Suki Assistant + Suki Platform (for partners)
- First to integrate with MEDITECH Expanse Documentation APIs
- Expanding to orders, nurses, home care

**EHR Integration:** athenahealth, Oracle Cerner, Epic, MEDITECH, WellSky

**Investors:** Venrock, Flare Capital, Breyer Capital, Zoom Ventures, Marc Benioff

**Positioning:** "Healthcare's new infrastructure" - platform for partners to build on

---

## 5. DeepScribe

**Status:** Oncology specialist

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Funding | ~$60M total (Series B latest) |
| Oncology Visits | 3.1M/year captured |
| Customers | Hundreds of health systems |

**Capabilities:**
- Ambient scribe (pre-visit, during, post-visit)
- Oncology-specific AI (longitudinal care)
- "Ambient Operating System" vision
- Available on AWS Marketplace

**Focus:** Oncology specialization, value-based care providers

**Customers:** Pearl Health (3,500+ primary care providers), NY Cancer & Blood Specialists

---

## 6. Commure / Augmedix

**Status:** Enterprise-scale ambient AI, HCA anchor customer

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Scale | ~1% of U.S. clinical visits |
| Focus | Enterprise health systems |
| Acquisition | Commure acquired Augmedix |

**Capabilities:**
- Ambient documentation at national scale
- Auto-coding (ICD-10, CPT)
- Clinical Decision Support (CDS)
- Clinical Documentation Integrity (CDI)
- Multi-agent orchestration with knowledge graph memory
- Vector retrieval, ontology-aware prompting
- Deterministic EHR tool use

**Technology:**
- Multi-model strategy (not single LLM)
- Knowledge graph with durable memory across encounters
- Guardrails architecture (red-teaming, PHI/PII controls)
- Test-time compute for complex reasoning

**EHR Integration:**
- Epic
- Meditech Expanse
- FHIR/HL7 integrations

**Customers:** HCA Healthcare (enterprise anchor), major health systems

**Differentiators:**
- Enterprise scale proven (millions of visits)
- Beyond-the-note capabilities shipped (not roadmap)
- Safety-first architecture with audit trails
- Hybrid human + AI legacy from Augmedix

---

## 7. Freed

**Status:** SMB disruptor

| Metric | Value |
|--------|-------|
| Pricing | $99/month per clinician |
| Users | 20,000+ paying clinicians |
| ARR | ~$19M (March 2025), +134% YoY |
| Funding | $30M Series A (March 2025, Sequoia) |

**Target Market:** Solo practitioners, small practices

**Value Prop:** Simple, quick-to-deploy, no enterprise complexity

**Saves:** 2-3 hours daily per clinician

---

## Competitive Landscape Summary

| Vendor | Valuation/Funding | Market Share | EHR Strength | Beyond Ambient | Global |
|--------|-------------------|--------------|--------------|----------------|--------|
| Nuance/Microsoft | Microsoft-backed | ~33% | Epic deep | Coding, CDS, Nursing | Yes |
| Abridge | $5.3B | ~30% | Epic "First Pal" | Revenue cycle, Prior auth | US-focused |
| Commure/Augmedix | Private | Enterprise | Epic, Meditech | Coding, CDI, CDS, Knowledge Graph | US-focused |
| Nabla | $120M raised | Growing | Multi-EHR, Connect | Coding, Agentic | EU + US |
| Suki | $70M Series D | Growing | MEDITECH leader | Platform/infra | US-focused |
| DeepScribe | ~$60M | Niche | AWS Marketplace | Oncology-specific | US-focused |
| Freed | $30M Series A | SMB | Limited | Basic | US-focused |
| Ambience | Unicorn | ~13% | TBD | TBD | US-focused |

---

## Key Trends (2025)

1. **Consolidation around Epic** - Nuance and Abridge battling for Epic shops
2. **Beyond ambient is the battleground** - Coding, CDI, CDS, revenue cycle
3. **Epic building native ("Art for Clinicians")** - Announced August 2025, threat to all vendors
4. **Multi-EHR matters** - Nabla Connect shows demand for EHR-agnostic solutions
5. **Nursing/MA expansion** - Nuance, Suki both moving beyond physicians
6. **International** - Nuance expanding to EU, Nabla accelerating EU from Paris base

---

## Ramsay Implications

For a global health system (AU, UK, EU, Asia):

| Factor | Best Fit |
|--------|----------|
| GDPR/EU compliance | Nabla (Paris HQ), Nuance (expanding EU) |
| Multi-EHR reality | Nabla Connect, Suki |
| Language diversity | Nabla (35+), Abridge (28+) |
| Data residency | Need to verify regional options |
| Vendor stability | Nuance (Microsoft), Abridge ($5.3B) |

---

*Intelligence gathered November 2025*
*Author: Alex Stinard, MD*
